title: 111_hr3292
content:
The Act is titled the "Judicial Survivors Protection Act of 2009" and includes definitions for various terms. The Act titled the "Judicial Survivors Protection Act of 2009" defines key terms such as Director, Judicial official, Judicial Survivors' Annuities Fund, and Judicial Survivors' Annuities System. The "open enrollment period" is a 6-month period starting 30 days after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 3. Any judicial official can choose to join the Judicial Survivors' Annuities System during the open enrollment period by submitting a written election to the Director. The election will be effective the following month. SEC. 4. Judicial officers must make contributions for their open enrollment election. Any judicial official who elects to participate in the Judicial Survivors' Annuities System during the open enrollment period agrees to have deductions from their salary and retirement salary, with exceptions for certain retired officials. Contributions under subsection (a) shall be 2.75 percent of retirement salary and credited to the Judicial Survivors' Annuities Fund. SEC. 5. DEPOSIT FOR PRIOR CREDITABLE SERVICE.

Any judicial official participating in the Judicial Survivors' Annuities System can make a lump sum deposit equal to 2.75 percent of salary plus 3 percent interest for the last 18 months of prior service to receive credit for judicial service required for a survivor's annuity. The deposit must be made during the open enrollment period and will be credited to the Judicial Survivors' Annuities Fund. SEC. 6. VOLUNTARY CONTRIBUTIONS FOR SURVIVORS' ANNUITY. Section 376 of title 28, United States Code, is amended to allow judicial officials enrolled in the Judicial Survivors' Annuities System to purchase additional creditable service in 3-month increments, regardless of previous contributions. This applies to all judicial officials, including those enrolled under the Judicial Survivors Protection Act of 2009. Judicial officials enrolled in the Judicial Survivors' Annuities System can purchase additional creditable service in 3-month increments for each year of completed service, as defined in the Act. The Act and its amendment will take effect on the date of enactment.
